THIS SCENE IS ALL I'VE EVER WANTED FROM THIS SHOW! #himym @HIMYM_CBS

If there are an infinite number of universes, does that mean there are infinite variations on #2BrokeGirls ?

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

As we open, the #2BrokeGirls are celebrating St. Patrick's Day by selling a large number of green cupcakes. They seem to be in a good mood.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Tiny Hans believes donning a Leprechaun suit will ensure him attaining sexual congress. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Orno the Horny Chef arrives in "Kiss Me I'm Irish" T-shirt with arrow pointing at his dick. He also has a "pee funnel" 4 women. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Cat suddenly bolting around room which I thought might be a sign of excitement over #2BrokeGirls but looks instead to be litterbox related.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

For tonight's entertainment, the #2BrokeGirls are stuck in a cab with Tiny Hans and Orbip the Horny Chef.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Cabbie threatens to cut out Orkop the Horny Chef's tongue, which Orkop assets will punish the "ladies of the tri-state area." #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Bonus joke: Garrett Morris in full Irish regalia, leading a bagpipe parade. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Unexpected Brian Doyle-Murray sighting on #2BrokeGirls. He just planted one on Caroline to great comic effect.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Tiny Hans is a hit at the bar. Drunk chicks want to have their picture taken with him. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Long line to Ladies Room--we have been set up for future puke joke. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

...and there it is. Drunk Girl has puked into her own hands. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Caroline is threatening to piss her pants. Time for Olnert the Horny Chef's "pee funnel" to become Chekov's gun. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Polish Cougar arrives on St. Paddy's float with a quintet of cut firemen. She's the "pole," she says. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Upon further reflection, this "pole" joke binding Cougar's ethnicity and her fireman horniness may be the best #2BrokeGirls joke ever.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Essentially a throwaway holiday episode. No Deke, no cat, no chestnut, no plot--#2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Caroline has brought Max to the Plaza Hotel to see how rich Irish A-holes get drunk. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

After a brief detour to prove that rich people are boring, the #2BrokeGirls return to the first bar where the "real" people are. Poor=folk

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

As we close, it seems Max, Caroline, and Polish Cougar will be fornicating with six NYPD firemen. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

Tiny Hans has also gotten lucky, his Leprechaun act having snared a woman who is double his weight. #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014

A classic of its kind--light as a feather and utterly inconsequential, with a feeble effort at folksy moralizing. Brava! #2BrokeGirls

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) March 18, 2014
